poem:
**Shadow of Thatcher**

In Yorkshire's chill,
Miv's young heart bids—
stories of night, 
penned fears grip tight,
while Thatcher's iron 
hangs gray 
above waking fears.
Ripples of a killer
and whispers of 
a new order,
society cheats dawn—
a list of suspicion
on brittle Sunday sheets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The List of Suspicious Things by Jennie Godfrey audiobook review – coming of age in a time of fear Set in Yorkshire in 1979 shortly after the election of Margaret Thatcher, Jennie Godfrey’s novel revolves around a working-class family living in the shadow of a new Conservative government and the Yorkshire Ripper murders. The novel opens with 12-year-old Miv quietly fretting about the stories in the papers of young women being killed and her aunt’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
